original: Bacler d'Albe was a strategic advisor to Emperor Napoleon Bonaparte, notable for his long-standing association with the Emperor and his unique contributions to military strategy. Following the definitive fall of the Empire in 1815, Bacler d'Albe faced professional challenges, including surveillance by the monarchy. He subsequently retired to his residence in Sèvres, where he continued to work as a lithographic artist, producing hundreds
